title.narrative: Faith Action on Covid-19 Transformation in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: CASL is proposing a limited set of interventions, to deepen gains and minimize impact on vulnerable groups in three districts - Western Rural, Bo and Pujehun, building on its Code 1 and earlier CA Appeal funding investments with its partner RADA who will work closely with inter-faith leaders through the Side-by-Side movement to scale messaging, support vulnerable groups and ensure local capacity to sustain engagements on Covid-19 and Sexual and Gender Based Violence. CASL will weave these interventions with existing support to earlier initiatives with inter-faith groups, using RADA's experience working with inter-faith leaders to ensure engagements at the district, chiefdom and community levels. The Side-by-Side movement had earlier been supported to disseminate Covid-19 messages and to support with handwashing materials in the early stages of the pandemic. This support will seek to strengthen these actions and to reach beyond Freetown to the provinces. RADA has been involved with local faith leaders in dissemination of Covid-19 prevention messages in the south of the country, buiding capacity of community members and distributing handwashing kits including soap to 20 rural communities

- Increased reach and knowledge on Covid-19 preventions and mitigation - symptoms and how to prevent it, and who is most at risk, reporting suspected cases/referrals. - Decreased social and economic impact of Covid-19 on the most vulnerable. - Increased capacity of faith actors to provide appropriate counselling and referral for victims of SGBV, stigmatization and discrimination.
